metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27823 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in OpenJPEGâ€™s encoder. This flaw allows an attacker topass specially crafted x,y offset input to OpenJPEG to use during encoding.The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality,integrity, as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27823` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-1ubuntu5').
insighttoolkit4 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
blender package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
texmaker package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
